explanations.machine learning: The paper uses advanced data mining techniques and classification algorithms, which are part of machine learning.
explanations.supervised learning: The study involves classification prediction models, which are a type of supervised learning.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on constructing mixed classification prediction models and uses various classification algorithms.
explanations.decision tree: The study mentions using decision tree C4.5 technology to build a knowledge base of decision rules and criteria.
explanations.feature learning: The paper selects 19 conditional attributes (features) from the insurance client database, indicating a focus on feature learning.
explanations.feature representation: The selection and use of conditional attributes (X1-X19) suggest an emphasis on feature representation in the models.
